data.title: 1. "Jeu de la mort", un jeu télévisé ou un candidat a pour mission d' envoyer une décharge électrique à son adversaire. - 2. Pourquoi les OGM font-ils peur?.
data.summary: 1. Dans le "Jeu de la mort"  le tortionnaire ne sait pas qu'il n'y a pas d'électricité et que la douleur est simulée par un comédien. Mais êtes-vous sûr de ne pas être prêt à tuer pour gagner ?. - 2. Alors que l'Union européenne s'apprête à autoriser les OGM, une polémique a actuellement cours en France sur l'indépendance des scientifiques chargés d'étudier les risques de ces mêmes organismes. Les scientifiques peuvent-ils être impartiaux, sérieux et indépendants dans leur recherche, et avoir une opinion?.

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 22 – 12.03.10 
 

MENU 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

0.40 Montage close ups of 
players and managers 

 Coming up: reputations are on the line as some of the games 
greats have it all to prove… 

    

0.47 Madrid action  Can Madrid’s Galaticos justify their massive transfer fees and turn 
round a first leg defeat in Lyon?  

    

0.54 Arsenal action   Arsenal are on the back foot against Porto.  Only a win will do… 
    

1.00 RONALDINHO  
(SPANISH) 

 

HELLO, I’M RONALDINHO.  WELCOME TO THE UEFA 
CHAMPIONS LEAGUE MAGAZINE SHOW 

    

1.05 Beckham and Ronaldinho b 
roll and action 

 We’re with two of football’s superstars – Ronaldinho and 
Beckham have one last chance to take Milan through to the 
quarters. 

    

1.14 Frey b roll  Plus we’re with Sebastien Frey ahead of Fiorentina’s crucial clash 
with the Germans giants of Munich 

   

 

1.19   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 22 – 12.03.10 
 

REAL MADRID V LYON  
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

1.20 Map to Real Madrid v Lyon  But first to Madrid, where Europe’s most expensive team had to 
prove their worth. 

    

1.27 GVs Madrid / Bernabeu  With this year’s final being held at the Bernabeu, the pressure on 
Real to succeed in the Champions League is even greater than 
normal, as Madrid legend Fernando Hierro fully understands.  

    

1.39 FERNANDO HIERRO 
(SPANISH) 
 

Madrid final sign 
Shot of Bernabeu  
Madrid badge and coach 
arrives 

 

I THINK THE FACT THAT WE COULD PLAY THE FINAL AT 
HOME IS A MOTIVATION. IF WE DON’T MAKE IT, WE’LL BE 
THINKING WE’VE WASTED AN OPPORTUNITY. I THINK THAT 
LYON PLAYED REALLY WELL AND PRESSURED US 
THROUGHOUT THE NINETY MINUTES AND MADE THINGS 
DIFFICULT AS WAS PREDICTED. I THINK MATCHES IN 
EUROPE ALWAYS GIVE YOU AN EXTRA SOMETHING WHEN 
YOU ARE PLAYING AT HOME. 

 

 

 

 

2.06 VOX POP 1  
(SPANISH) 
 

 

MADRID WILL WIN. 

 

 

 

 

2.08 VOX POP 2  
(FRENCH) 
Shot of Ronaldo, and scarf. 

 

LYON PLAYED A GOOD FIRST LEG. IT’S GOING TO BE 
COMPLICATED. THIS IS REAL, THEY SCORE LOTS AND 
HAVE BIG STARS. 

    

2.14 Kid blowing horn  NO SCRIPT 
 

 

 

 

2.15 Madrid fans singing  NO SCRIPT 
 

 

 

 

2.18 VOX POP 3 
(FRENCH) 

 

2-1 TO LYON. COME ON OL! 

    

2.21 
 

VOX POP 4 
(SPANISH) 
Shots of Kaka posters and 
Kaka warming up. 

 

I HOPE KAKA WILL PLAY A GOOD MATCH TODAY 
BECAUSE HE’S BEEN A BIT LOW SINCE THE SEASON 
BEGAN, HE’S NOT BEING HIMSELF. BUT I DREAMT THAT 
TODAY IT WAS GOING TO BE KAKA’S MATCH. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 22 – 12.03.10 
 

2.32 
 

 

 

 

Shots of warm ups, fan 
shots, teams out …. 

So would dreams come true for the Real Madrid fans? With the tie 
very much in the balance both teams would look to their star 
performers to deliver. One side would break their duck this 
evening. Madrid hadn’t reached the quarter finals in their last 5 
attempts and Lyon hadn’t progressed to the last 8 since 2006   

    

2.52 Kick off  
Kaka chance 

 With the partisan Bernabeu crowd in full voice it was their players 
who began seizing every chance they were given. But Hugo Lloris 
would prove a resolute barrier in goal as both Kaka…  

    

3.03 Ronaldo run  
Kaka fouled  
Ronaldo goal + celebs, 
gutted Lloris and 
scoreboard 

 …and Cristiano Ronaldo were being kept at bay. The Lyon 
keeper hadn’t conceded a goal in 10 and a half hours of football 
but that certainly wouldn’t dishearten Real’s two tormentors. And 
so the game was but 6 minutes old when Ronaldo fired in his 7th 
of the Champions League campaign – the perfect nutmeg giving 
his side hope for that dream final 

    

3.25 Ronaldo celeb 
Scoreboard 
Kaka shot at goal 

 The crowd were certainly enjoying what they were seeing 
As Kaka went in search of his second goal of the tournament. 

    

3.33 Higuain misses open goal, 
plus reaction, shot of Puel, 
Ronaldo cross to Kaka, 
Higuain shot saved 

 And it should have been 2-0 in the 26th minute - Gonzalo Higuain 
prevented by the upright and it wasn’t to be his night. Claude 
Puel’s men had arrived at the Bernabeu unbeaten in their last 8 
games.  And Lloris was showing just why his team are in such 
good form keeping Higuain out once more. 

    

3.54 Half time whistle, Ronaldo 
walking off, second half 
kick off 

 Half time talks required as the most expensive player on the 
planet knew his performance in the next 45 minutes would prove 
vital.  

    

4.02 Real struggling, good 
defence Lyon, Ronaldo and 
Kaka struggling 

 Yet again Real took the early control but Lyon were equal to 
everything they gave. Despite encouragement the 2002 
champions were looking stretched as Lyon had a refreshed 
impetus – their back four seemed impassable as they began 
believing.  

    

4.18 Kaka down, Kallstrom 
cross, Govou shot over bar 

 Momentum was everything and the French side were in the 
ascendancy. Half time substitute Kim Kallstrom found Sydney 
Govou who should have done better.  

    

    



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 22 – 12.03.10 
 

4.29 Kaka tackled again, Pjanic 
goal, reactions and celebs 
Pellegrini looking worried 

But Madrid still couldn’t find a way through and Lyon’s belief 
finally paid off - Miralem Pjanic silenced the Bernabeu 15 minutes 
from time. Madrid now needed 2 goals and change was required.

2.09 KO  
Arsenal early crosses 
leading to Arshavin chance  

 It’s not really Arsene Wenger’s style for his team to flood the box 
with crosses – but clearly that was the plan. And Arshavin, the 
smallest player on the pitch, almost profited.   

    

 

 

 

 

  

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 22 – 12.03.10 
 

2.22 

 

 

Wenger close up 
Nasri controlling game + 
sets up 1-0  
Fans, celebs,  
Helton with ice pack 

Meanwhile Samir Nasri was deputising ably for his captain in the 
creative midfield role – no real surprise he set up the opener. 
Arshavin’s run caused confusion – and amid the flailing bodies, 
Nicklas Bendtner pounced. Arsenal ahead on the night – and in 
front on away goals. Helton wasn’t the only man who looked 
dazed and disorientated.  

    

2.43 
 

Falcao and Hulk strong 
running but going nowhere 

 At the other end Falcao and Hulk were willing runners – but failed 
to fashion a chance worthy of the name. 

    

2.49 
 

Crowd shot  
Arshavin more and more in 
game – sets up 2-0 for 
Bendtner 

 And 25 minutes in Arsenal scored again – the diminutive Arshavin 
has an uncanny knack of bouncing off defenders. A lay off to 
Bendtner – the Dane couldn’t miss. Just what Wenger 
wanted…Porto coach Jesualdo Ferreira was already fearing the 
worst. 

    

3.03 Arshavin misses easy 
chance after good work by 
Nasri and Diaby 

 His side might have been further behind – Nasri danced to the 
byline – but Arshavin couldn’t give the move the gloss finish it 
deserved.   

    

3.13 Hulk run and shot – easy 
save 

 Then a fleeting sight of goal for the twice European champions – 
but Hulk hardly tested Alumnia.  

    

3.21 Three good saves by 
Helton from Bendtner, 
Diaby, Nasri  
Halftime 

 Helton, though was working overtime. Bendtner, Diaby and Nasri 
all denied in the space of five frantic minutes. So just 2-0 at half-
time – 3-2 Arsenal overall. 

    

3.32 Porto start second half with 
purpose – Meireles shoots 
over 

 Which meant a Porto goal would force extra time. Raul Meireles 
couldn’t provide it. 

    

3.39 Falcao has shot saved after 
good work by Rodriguez 
(half time sub) 

 But Porto, chasing their first win in England at the 14th attempt, 
suddenly had a foothold. Falcao scored that controversial winner 
in Portugal – but couldn’t repeat the trick. 

    

3.49 Nasri off the line from 
Rodriguez header  
Wenger looking worried 
Eboue on 

 They came close again when Nasri cleared off the line from 
substitute Rodriguez’s and Wenger was concerned enough to 
make a change – Eboue for Rosicky…strength for flair. And 
having survived Porto’s pressure,..

4.01 Nasri 3-0 + celebs 
Wenger still concerned 

…Arsenal put the tie to bed with a goal of rare quality. Nasri’s 
mesmeric run and a finish that was pure precision. But amid all 
the celebrations – one man still didn’t think the job was done.

 His side stayed resilient… And then scored a classic break away 
goal – Arshavin to Eboue, a player jeered by his own fans a year 
ago, is now a cult hero here. He says it’s all down to the coach. 
There was still time for Eboue to cause more mayhem…

9.14 Map to Fiorentina v Bayern  NO SCRIPT 
    

9.17 Vargas goal  Trailing 2-1 from the first leg, Cesare Prandelli had urged 
Fiorentina not to rush to score against Bayern – and his team took 
heed – Juan Vargas put the hosts ahead before the half hour 
mark. 

    

9.29 Jovetic goal  But 4 goals in the space of 11 second half minutes would decide 
the game – a cheeky back heel from Alberto Gilardino found 
Stefan Jovetic and Fiorentina were heading for the last 8. 

    

9.41 Van Bommel goal  Bayern hadn’t lost a game in their last 18 and they were showing 
signs as to why – Marc Van Bommel seized the all important 
away goal. 

    

9.50 Jovetic goal  Having not qualified for the quarter finals for 40 years the hosts 
took strength from their vociferous crowd – Jovetic muscling his 
way through, 4-3 on aggregate.  

    

10.03 Jovetic celeb 
Robben goal 

 Louis Van Gaal had promised a great spectacle from his side and 
they didn’t disappoint. Just a minute later Arjen Robben danced 
his way thorough the midfield to launch a thunderous strike 
leaving Sebastian Frey no chance at all.   

    

10.17 Robben goal replay and 
celebs 

 So despite loosing on the night, away goals take the German side 
though to the quarter finals for the second successive season.   

    

10.24   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 22 – 12.03.10 
 

ONE TO WATCH 
    

TIME PICTURE:SOUND  COMMENTARY 
    

10.25 Previews map and  
One to watch sting 

 So 4 teams have made it through to the quarter finals but there 
are still 4 spaces up for grabs – and the game everyone is talking 
about see’s the return of Jose Mourinho to Stamford Bridge… 

    

10.37 Jose close up, Inter goals 
and celebs. Kalou goal and 
celeb 

 The first leg was a highly charged affair in Milan which the Italians 
won 2-1. But Salomon Kalou’s away goal arguably gives the 
English side a slight edge - a 1-0 Chelsea victory in London will 
put them through. 

    

10.49 Cech injury plus Hilario 
coming on in Milan 

 Both teams have injury worries but most significantly, Chelsea will 
be without keeper Petr Cech. Replacement Hilario was criticised 
after a poor display in a recent domestic game. 

    

10.59 Mourinho celebs at 
Chelsea 
Chelsea street sign 

 Jose Mourinho spent three highly decorated years at Chelsea and 
has made no secret of his enduring love for the club. But on 
what’s sure to be an emotional evening in west London – his only 
concern will be to knock out his former employers. The whole 
football world will be watching. 

    

11.14 SALOMAN KAOU 
(ENGLISH) 

 

WE KNOW WHAT JOSE IS ABOUT. WE KNOW THAT WHEN 
HE HAS TO KEEP THE RESULT HE’S VERY GOOD AT IT SO 
IT’S GOING TO BE A TOUGH GAME. 

    

11.22 Kalou B-Roll  Next week we’ll have more of this exclusive interview with Kalou 
as he looks to plot Mourinho’s downfall and help the Blues 
overturn their first leg defeat. 

    

11.31   End 
    

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 
 

UEFA Champions League 2009 - 2010 
Magazine Programme  

Script – Show 22 – 12.03.10 
 

CLOSER

 So congratulations to Lyon on their shock defeat of Real Madrid

goal, Olympiacos GV,

as the road to Madrid rolls on. 

    

11.51   End

chapters.excerpt: * Garmisch-Partenkirchen : 20100312 et archives, le skieur suisse JANKA Carlo a remporté le classement général de la Coupe du monde de ski alpin 2010 grâce à sa victoire dans le slalom géant messieurs des finales de la Coupe du monde de ski alpin. Il est le 1er suisse à le remporter la Coupe du monde de ski alpin depuis ACCOLA Paul en 1992.

* FRANCE, Fribourg-ville : 20100312, itw du professeur de la Haute-école de gestion INARTAGLIA Julien qui débriefait les participants du documentaire intitulé Le jeu de la mort qui reproduisait à travers un faux jeu télévisé une expérience de psychologie appliquée. Cette dernière consistait à observer jusqu'où un candidat pouvait faire preuve de sadisme lorsqu'il était soumis à une forte autorité, ici celle du public et de l'animatrice de l'émission.
chapters.remarks:
LMM01 ET XVM01 : 1'05" 
LMM02 ET XVM02 : 2'11"

chapters.excerpt: * VATICAN : 20100312, le président de la Conférence des Evêques d'Allemagne Monseigneur ZOLLITSCH Robert s'est entretenu avec le pape Benoît XVI au sujet des nombreux actes pédophiles commis par des religieux allemands. Au terme de l'entretien, Monseigneur ZOLLITSCH Robert a présenté ses excuses aux victimes et a affirmé la volonté de l'Eglise catholique allemande de collaborer pleinement avec la justice.
chapters.remarks:
BLETRA, Nadia 
DE LA VARENNE, Eric

chapters.excerpt: * Karachi : 20100312 et archives récentes, suite aux nombreuses opérations militaires américaines, les membres des organisations terroristes talibanes se réfugient dans les quartiers populaires de la ville où ils peuvent se fondre dans la population et échapper aux recherches des autorités pakistanaises.

* Bochuz, Lausanne, Vaud : 20100312 et archives 2008, un détenu de la prison des des Etablissements de la plaine de l'Orbe VOGT Skander est décédé lors de l'incendie de sa cellule qu'il avait lui-même provoqué. L'avocat de ce détenu réputé dangereux qui aurait du être interné dans asile psychiatrique a déposé une plainte car les gardiens de la prison n'ont pas porté immédiatement assistance au détenu mais ont préféré attendre l'arrivée des forces spéciales de police qui ont mis 90 minutes pour rejoindre la prison.

* Cointrin : 20100312, le Conseil fédéral a approuvé un projet permettant aux passagers des vols internationaux arrivant à l'Aéroport international de Genève d'accéder aux commerces et magasins hors-taxes avant de quitter l'aéroport. Un tel projet amènerait une manne financière importante pour l'aéroport même si certains déplorent une offre facilitée d'achat pour les cigarettes ou l'alcool.

* Zurich-ville : 20100312, la chaîne allemande des supermarchés discounters Lidl a présenté une conférence de presse sur le bilan de son implantation en Suisse alémanique. Les dirigeants n'y ont mentionné aucun chiffres mais ont déclaré que cette implantation allait se poursuivre en Suisse romande.

* Lillehammer : 20100312, victoire du sauteur à ski suisse AMMANN Simon qui s'est imposé dans le dernier concours comptant pour la Coupe du monde de saut à ski. Cette victoire lui permet de remporter le classement général de la Coupe du monde de saut à ski, ce qu'aucun Suisse n'avait réussi avant lui.

* Lillehammer : 20100312, victoire du sauteur à ski suisse AMMANN Simon qui s'est imposé dans le dernier concours comptant pour la Coupe du monde de saut à ski. Cette victoire lui permet de remporter le classement général de la Coupe du monde de saut à ski, ce qu'aucun Suisse n'avait réussi avant lui.

* Neuchâtel-ville : 20100312 et archives, réunis lors d'une conférence, les conseillers d'états et chefs des départements de la Sécurité romands ont émis le souhait d'une prise en charge financière par les clubs sportifs des coûts des mesures policières mises en place hors des stades ou des patinoires lors de matchs dits sensibles. Pour l'instant, les clubs romands ont exprimé un refus poli.

Locuteur FS2 (0:00:13 > 0:01:41) [92%] :

chapters.excerpt: * Montreux : 20100312 et archives, en attente de son procès pour corruption passive, le conseiller municipal DORIOT Jean-Claude va pouvoir reprendre ses activités politiques après un accord avec l'exécutif de la ville.

* Genève-ville : 20100312, les autorités cantonales et municipales ont officiellement lancé l'ouverture du chantier de la nouvelle gare ferroviaire CFF de Cornavin. Ce chantier coûtera 110 millions de francs et devrait prendre fin en automne 2013.

* Gléresse : 20100312, la pisciculture spécialisée dans la culture des bondelles et des truites de rivières organise de nombreuses visites afin de faire connaître les cycles de reproduction des poissons du lac de Bienne.

* Garmisch-Partenkirchen : 20100312 et archives, le skieur suisse JANKA Carlo a remporté le classement général de la Coupe du monde de ski alpin 2010 grâce à sa victoire dans le slalom géant messieurs des finales de la Coupe du monde de ski alpin. Il est le 1er suisse à le remporter la Coupe du monde de ski alpin depuis ACCOLA Paul en 1992.

* Garmisch-Partenkirchen : 20100312, victoire de la skieuse américaine VONN Lindsey qui s'est imposée dans le super-g dames des finales de la Coupe du monde de ski alpin. Cette victoire lui permet de remporter le globe de cristal du classement général de la Coupe du monde de ski alpin dames pour la 3e année consécutive. La Suissesse STYGER Nadia termine 3e du super-g derrière l'Autrichienne GOERGL Elisabeth.

scripts:
2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 1 

ROAD TO THE 2010 FIFA WORLD CUP™ 

EPISODE 4 
Play-out: 12 March 2010; 14:00 GMT 

 

SCRIPT 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND COMMENTARY 

10:00:31 Trophy Welcome to programme 4 in this 16 part series 

that focuses on the teams contesting the FIFA 

World Cup™ in June and July. 

   
10:00:39 Serbia action In this episode we feature two sides who had very 

different routes to South Africa. We start with 

Serbia, a country playing in its first Finals as an 

independent nation. 

   
10:00:48 Antic in training Radomir Antic’s men dominated a qualifying group 

that included tricky opposition like Austria and 

Romania as well as 1998 champions, France. 

   
10:00:58 Street celebs The White Eagles may well cause some more 

upsets come June! 

   
10:01:04 New Zealand 

training 

In contrast to Serbia’s smooth progress to South 

Africa, New Zealand qualified in the most dramatic 

fashion.  

   
10:01:12 Action A nail biting play-off win over Bahrain provided 

this rugby-mad nation with a place at football’s 

greatest event. 

   
10:01:21 Herbert cu The All Whites will start as outsiders in June – can 

Ricki Herbert’s men prove the doubters wrong and 

qualify for the second round? 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 2 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND COMMENTARY 

10:01:35 Graphic We begin with Serbia. Placed in Group D alongside 

Germany, Australia and Ghana. 

   
10:01:43 Graphic Their campaign begins on 13th June against the 

Black Stars in Pretoria, they then move to Port 

Elizabeth and Nelspruit to face Germany and 

Australia respectively. 
   
10:01:56 Belgrade street 

celebs  

Serbia will participate as an independent nation for 

the first time at a FIFA World Cup™ Finals in June 

– the country ended its brief political and football 

partnership with neighbouring Montenegro back in 

2006.  
   
10:02:21 Belgrade street 

celebs 

The scenes of joy that spilled onto Belgrade’s 

streets following qualification were a celebration of 

independence and sporting excellence. 
   
10:02:36 SOT: ZORAN 

TOSIC 
 
(SERBIAN) 
 

IT’S A FANTASTIC ACHIEVEMENT, EVERYONE 

COULD SEE THAT WE PLAYED GREAT 

FOOTBALL THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE 

QUALIFICATION, EVERYTHING WENT TO 

PLAN WITH US GIVING OUR BEST AND IN 

THE END DELIVERING THE GOODS TO THE 

CONTENTMENT OF BOTH OURSELVES THE 

PLAYERS, AND OF EVERYONE AT HOME 
   
10:02:57 After SOT 

France v Serbia  

2-1 

Serbia’s road to South Africa began with a 

comfortable win over the Faroe Islands, but then

Locuteur MS18 (0:17:08 > 0:17:13) [94%] : 
Et pour des dizaines de milliers de la possibilité de vibrer à distance pour Fribourg- Gottéron.


Locuteur FS6 (0:17:14 > 0:17:36) [93%] : 
Et pour terminer, on va s'intéresser au cirque Starlight établi à Porrentruy, la famille Gasser et dans le métier depuis 5 générations, et pour ce petit cirque familial difficile de se payer les plus grandes Stars du coup, on mise sur la créativité du spectacle, cette année, les artistes sont allés chercher l'inspiration du côté de Cuba, Pascal Bourquin s'est glissé dans les coulisses des dernières répétitions.


Locuteur MS20 (0:17:41 > 0:17:44) [86%] : 
Pour sa tournée 2010, le cirque Starlight s'est mise à.


Locuteur FS21 (0:17:44 > 0:17:54) [90%] : 
Leur tube nous revenons de La Havane, on nous avons préparé cette création pendant un mois, inédite et sur le thème par Flight.


Locuteur MS20 (0:17:56 > 0:18:27) [90%] : 
Flight parce que le fil rouge du spectacle est un voyage à bord d'un avion, un voyage évidemment très vite, sur fond de musique cubaine un voyage pour lequel le cirque suisse a lui- même voyager, c'est en effet ici à La Havane, plus précisément sous le chapiteau du cirque national de Cuba que le nouveau programme a été élaboré, on voit l'enquête avait dit qu'durant tout le mois de février, les artistes de la famille Starlight ont collaboré avec des homologues cubains, dont certains ont été engagés pour la saison.


Locuteur MS20 (0:18:29 > 0:18:37) [91%] : 
Et c'est aussi à La Havane qu'a été travaillé la mise en scène de ce spectacle qui se veut davantage qu'une succession de numéros, on a.


Locuteur MS13 (0:18:37 > 0:18:45) [81%] : 
ça de fait savoir compte entre théâtre et cirque, on fait du cirque, mais on le fait dans un cadre de dire je raconte de raconter une histoire.


Locuteur FS21 (0:18:47 > 0:18:52) [83%] : 
Et bien le point fixe la regarde le public quoi là.


Locuteur MS20 (0:18:52 > 0:18:58) [94%] : 
Et en fait, ce spectacle est une mise en abyme puisqu'il raconte tout simplement l'expérience cubaine du cirque Starlight.


Locuteur FS21 (0:18:59 > 0:19:10) [91%] : 
Le spectateur se retrouve en réalité avec nos artistes dans un avion qui atterrira à La Havane et qui fera un passage à la plage de Cuba, où après, revenir dans le pays.


Locuteur FS6 (0:19:16 > 0:19:24) [91%] : 
Voilà c'est la fin de cette émission, merci de l'avoir suivi, j'aurai le plaisir de vous retrouver lundi même place même heure en attendant de passer un très bon week- end.

chapters.excerpt: * Porrentruy, La Havane : 20100312, présentation du nouveau spectacle de la compagnie du cirque Starlight inspiré par le voyages de ses artistes au cirque national de Cuba à La Havane.
chapters.remarks: SUJET UNIQUEMENT DISPONIBLE SUR LE TEMOIN

chapters.excerpt: * Sion : 20100312, lors d'une session du Grand Conseil valaisan, des députés ont déposé 4 interpellations portant sur la qualité des soins hospitaliers dans le canton suite à la polémique lancée par le chirurgien SAVIOZ Daniel. Le conseiller d'Etat valaisan en charge de la santé TORNAY Maurice réclame lui des statistiques fiables.
* Lausanne : 20100312, GABRIEL Viviane mène des itw lors de la traditionnelle foire commerciale d'Habitats et jardins sur les nouvelles tendances d'ameublement dans les cuisines.

* Meyrin, Genève-ville : 20100312, les concepteurs de l'entreprise Quickmeuble proposent un site internet où l'on peut concevoir des meubles en bois sur mesure qui seront ensuite découpés puis livrés prêt à être montés par le client.

* Berne, Reconvilier : 20100312 et archives 2005, réactions de l'ancien représentant syndical des ouvriers de l'entreprise Swissmétal Boillat 5 ans après l'échec de la grève des employés face aux restructurations décidées par l'ancienne direction de l'entreprise.

* Fribourg-ville : 20100312, le journaliste de Radio Fribourg ALLEMANN Bernardin consacre l'essentiel de son activité professionnelle à couvrir l'actualité et les matchs du club de hockey sur glace du championnat suisse de hockey sur glace LNA le HC Fribourg Gottéron.

data.title: SOURCE - 10.03.12
scripts:
2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 1 

2010 FIFA WORLD CUP™ MAGAZINE 

EPISODE 14 
Play-out 12 March 2010; 12:00 GMT 

PROGRAMME CONTENTS 

 Time code Duration 

Opening Titles & Teasers 10:00:00 00’47” 

   

100 Days Roadshow 10:00:47 03’30” 

  

Sting: In The Spotlight 10:04:41 00’05” 

Jérôme Valcke 10:04:46 04’05” 

  

Sting: On The Ball 10:08:51 00’05” 

Soweto Derby 10:08:56 04’25” 

  

Sting: Milestones 10:13:21 00’05” 

Workshop 10:13:26 03’26” 

  

Sting: Essential Africa 10:16:52 00’05” 

Legend Golf & Safari Resort 10:16:57 05’28” 

  

Sting: FIFA World Cup™ People 10:22:25 00’05” 

Bruce Sutherland 10:22:30 03’30” 

  

End Credits & Logo 10:26:00 00’25” 

OUT 10:26:25  

  
 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 2 

TITLE:  

FEATURE – HEADLINES 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

00:05 After wipe  Coming up, a whistle-stop tour of the nine host cities, 

in the company of FIFA and the LOC. 

    
00:12 After wipe  We sample the atmosphere at South Africa’s biggest 

domestic game, the Soweto derby. 

    
00:20 After wipe  And we take a swing for a million dollars at Legend 

Golf & Safari Resort.  

    
   END 

 
TITLE:  

FEATURE – 100 DAYS ROADSHOW 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

00:49 Two seconds in  Earlier this month, Soccer City became the tenth and 

final World Cup stadium to be completed and was 

handed over to the city of Johannesburg at a 

ceremony inside this impressive new facility, which will 

host both the opening game and the final of the 2010 

tournament.  

    
01:07 From cameraman 

 

 

 

 A few days earlier, the media, FIFA and the LOC had 

stopped off at the stadium on the first day of a tour of 

the nine host cities. Jérôme Valcke and Danny Jordaan 

were on hand to address journalists from around the 

world, and Jordaan was in upbeat mood as the finish 

line draws ever nearer. 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 3 

 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

01:27 SOT: DANNY 

JORDAAN (ENGLISH) 

 

CEO, LOC 

 IT’S 100 DAYS TO GO TO KICK-OFF IN THIS 

WONDERFUL STADIUM ON 11TH JUNE BUT IT’S 16 

YEARS OF HARD WORK THAT BROUGHT US HERE 

AND SPECIFICALLY AFTER 2004 THE BUILDING OF 

INFRASTRUCTURE AND THE STADIUMS AND WE 

ARE VERY HAPPY THAT WE CAN SHOW THE 

WORLD COMPLETED STADIUMS.   

    
01:48 After SOT - map and 

images 

 Later that day, the media tour headed north to 

Pretoria, just a short drive from Johannesburg, where a 

number of teams will be based throughout the 

tournament.  Then it was off to Rustenburg’s Royal 

Bafokeng Stadium, a venue that’s been upgraded for 

the tournament. It’s here that one of the favourites, 

England, will open their campaign against the USA on 

June 12th.  

    
02:14 After lawnmower 

 

 

 

 From Rustenburg, the following morning, it was a 

short flight to Polokwane for the weary travellers, to 

take in the brand new 45,000 capacity Peter Mokaba 

stadium.   

    
02:26 From map  That was followed by a visit to Nelspruit, also a new 

venue, where the scribes and snappers were treated to 

a traditional welcome before heading inside to admire 

the Mbombela Stadium.     

    
02:43 After stadium GV  From Nelspruit in the north-east to Cape Town in the 

south-west, with a quick stop in Bloemfontein en 

route, where the local Celtic fans are sure to be in fine 

voice during the FIFA World Cup.   



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 4 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

02:59 After fans  And then on to Cape Town, where the city’s Green 

Point Stadium has much to admire, although the 

holding cells for unruly fans in the catacombs of the 

arena attracted much interest from the media. 

    
03:13 From presser  Having secured her freedom, local politician Helen Zille 

joined FIFA and the LOC at a busy press conference, 

where excitement and pride were the overriding 

themes.   

    
03:25 SOT: HELEN ZILLE 

(ENGLISH) 

 

Premier, Western Cape 

 TODAY MEANS THAT THE GREATEST SHOW ON 

EARTH IS FINALLY ON THE ROAD. WE’VE MADE IT 

THROUGH FOUR AND FIVE YEARS OF 

PREPARATION, LOTS OF HURDLES, LOTS OF 

OBSTACLES, AND NOW WE’RE HERE. WE CAN SEE 

THE END OF THE BEGINNING AND THEN THE 

BEGINNING OF THE GREATEST SHOW IN THE 

WORLD WHICH IS SO MUCH MORE THAN A 

FOOTBALL GAME. WE’RE READY. 

    
03:45 After SOT  From Cape Town to Port Elizabeth, where there were 

yet more questions for P.E. native Danny Jordaan to 

field from the assembled media.  

    
03:54 From vuvuzela welcome  And then it was on to the final stop on the Roadshow, 

Durban, in Kwa-Zulu Natal, where FIFA President Sep 

Blatter paid a visit to the impressive Moses Mabhida 

Stadium. Three time champions Germany will face 

Australia on June 13th.    

    
04:12 From press on pitch  For FIFA, the LOC, and South Africa as a whole, this 

tour was yet another important milestone on their 

journey to this historic event. 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 5 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

04:23 SOT: DANNY 

JORDAAN (ENGLISH) 

 

CEO, LOC 

 WITH 100 DAYS TO GO WE CAN DEFINITELY SAY 

MR PRESIDENT OF FIFA WE WILL NOT FAIL YOU. 

THIS IS GOING TO BE A WONDERFUL 

CELEBRATION AND OUR PEOPLE ARE HAPPY, OUR 

PEOPLE ARE EXCITED, OUR PEOPLE ARE LOOKING 

FORWARD TO IT AND LET THE GAMES BEGIN. 

    
04:40   END 

 
TITLE:  

FEATURE – IN THE SPOTLIGHT: JÉRÔME VALCKE 

 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

04:46 From top  With three months to go before Africa’s first World 

Cup gets underway, we caught up with Jérôme  Valcke 

to get his thoughts on a number of topics - and we 

began by asking him if South Africa will be ready come 

June 11th? 

    
04:59 SOT: JÉRÔME VALCKE 

(ENGLISH)  

 

Secretary General, 

FIFA 

 

 I WOULD SAY ‘I HOPE SO’, I HOPE THEY ARE ON 

TRACK. THERE’S STILL SOME WORK, SOME WORK 

TO DO TOGETHER - FIFA AND THE LOC. THE MAIN 

TASK IS TO MAKE SURE THAT WE WILL BE HAPPY 

BY THE 11TH JULY. I DON’T THINK THAT 11TH JUNE 

IS THE TARGET. THE TARGET IS 11TH JULY. THE 

11TH JUNE IS JUST WHEN WE WILL PUSH THE 

START BUTTON OF THE CAR AND WE’LL MAKE 

SURE THAT THE CAR WILL START AND THAT WE 

WILL HAVE ENOUGH PETROL AND ENOUGH OIL 

IN THE CAR SO THAT THIS CAR CAN BE ON THE 

ROAD FOR 30 DAYS WITHOUT STOPPING. THAT’S 

THE MAIN CHALLENGE WE HAVE. 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 6 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

05:40 Valcke at Final Draw  Three months ago, Valcke took centre stage alongside 

Oscar-winning actress Charlize Theron at the Final 

Draw in Cape Town. 

    
05:49 SOT: JÉRÔME VALCKE 

(ENGLISH)  

 

 

 

 IT WENT VERY WELL, IT WAS A VERY NICE DRAW 

– I THINK SO. IT WAS A NICE SHOW. IT’S 

AMAZING HOW THIS FINAL DRAW IS BECOMING 

SUCH A BIG EVENT, IT’S NOT JUST A DRAW. IT 

WAS PERFECTLY ORGANISED BY THE SOUTH 

AFRICANS. WE GAVE THEM GOOD MUSIC, WE 

GAVE THEM FINALLY A GOOD DRAW AND I 

THINK THAT YOU HAVE VERY GOOD GROUPS 

AND THE 32 TEAMS I’M SURE FOR MOST OF 

THEM EXCEPT MAYBE FOR SOUTH AFRICA 

HAVING TO PLAY AT LEAST FRANCE AND MEXICO 

WHICH ARE NOT EASY TEAMS, FRANCE NOT 

ALWAYS BUT SOMETIMES, THAT THEY HAVE 

BALANCED GROUPS I WOULD SAY FOR THE 

WORLD CUP.  

    
06:26 Stadium  So, 64 games to look forward to, but will these 

stadiums be full to capacity? 

    
06:32 SOT: JÉRÔME VALCKE 

(ENGLISH)  

 

 

 WE HAVE 2.9 MILLION TICKETS SO WE SOLD 

AROUND TWO MILLION TICKETS. YOU COULD 

SAY, “OH GOSH, THEY’VE SOLD TWO MILLION 

TICKETS ALREADY” OR “OH GOSH, THEY’VE STILL 

GOT 900,000 TICKETS TO SELL”. IF YOU 

REMEMBER AT THE PRE-DRAW WE ANNOUNCED 

THAT 25 PER CENT OF THE TICKETS WILL GO TO 

SOUTH AFRICANS FOR CATEGORY 4 LEVEL. WE 

ARE FAR BELOW THIS NUMBER FOR THE TIME  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 7 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

   BEING. I THINK WE ARE BETWEEN 15 AND 18 PER 

CENT SO WE STILL HAVE TO IMPROVE THIS 

NUMBER TO MAKE SURE THAT WE GIVE TO 

SOUTH AFRICANS, AND A LOT OF SOUTH 

AFRICANS, THE CHANCE TO COME TO THE 

STADIUM.   

    
07:11 After SOT  Up to half-a-million fans are expected to descend on 

South Africa in June, and Valcke, a frequent visitor to 

the country in recent years, believes there’ll be much 

to admire once they arrive on these shores.  

    
07:24 SOT: JÉRÔME VALCKE 

(ENGLISH)  

 

 

 FIRST I THINK DEFINITELY THE STADIUMS. I MEAN 

WHEN THEY COME TO DURBAN IT’S JUST AN 

AMAZING STADIUM, DURBAN. BUT ALSO SOCCER 

CITY. IT’S JUST HUGE. I THINK THAT ALSO THEY 

WILL, I THINK THEY WILL DISCOVER A COUNTRY. 

FOR SOME COUNTRIES LIKE ENGLAND, THEY 

KNOW ABOUT SOUTH AFRICA BECAUSE A LOT OF 

ENGLISH PEOPLE FLY TO CAPE TOWN FOR 

CHRISTMAS. THEY WILL DISCOVER THAT IT IS A 

BEAUTIFUL COUNTRY.   

    
07:49 After SOT – Italy training  The teams, of course, will have little time for tourism. 

They’re more interested in the stadia, the hotels and, 

of course, the training camps. 

    
07:58 SOT: JÉRÔME VALCKE 

(ENGLISH)  

 WHAT I KNOW IS THE REACTION FROM THE 

TEAMS AND ALL THE TEAMS ARE VERY HAPPY 

ABOUT THE FACILITIES THAT THEY HAVE. I THINK 

THAT THERE IS NOT A SINGLE TEAM WHO HAS 

SAID THAT THEY WERE NOT HAPPY WITH THE 

LEVEL OF ACCOMMODATION, THE TRAINING  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 8 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

   CAMPS THAT THEY HAVE, THE PITCHES WE PUT 

IN PLACE. HERE AGAIN WE HAVE BEEN WORKING 

WITH THE LOC TO ENSURE THAT WE IMPROVE 

ALL THESE FACILITIES. EVEN THE TEAMS THAT 

WENT TO THE CONFEDERATIONS CUP, NONE OF 

THEM HAS SAID ANYTHING BAD OR NEGATIVE 

ON SOUTH AFRICA. 

    
08:27 After SOT - Valcke  Finally then, with the big kick-off fast approaching, 

what’s the Secretary General looking forward to most 

about the 19th FIFA World Cup™? 

    
08:36 SOT: JÉRÔME VALCKE 

(ENGLISH)  

 TO THE GLASS OF CHAMPAGNE WITH DANNY 

JORDAAN ON 11TH JULY, EVEN IF HE IS NOT 

DRINKING A DROP OF ALCOHOL. I TOLD HIM WE 

WILL OPEN A BOTTLE OF CHAMPAGNE ON THE 

11TH JULY AND THE TWO OF US WILL BE DRUNK 

AFTER FIVE YEARS OF HARD WORK. 

    
08:51   END 

 
TITLE:  

FEATURE – SOWETO DERBY 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

08:59 Two secs in  South Africa is home to one of football’s fiercest 

derbies.  

    
09:09 Aerial shot after tackle  It’s a rivalry that, for ninety minutes at least, is known 

to divide families.  

    
09:16 GVs towers/road after 

fans 

 It’s more than just two local teams doing battle.  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 9 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

09:22 Fans after ref  It’s Orlando Pirates versus Kaizer Chiefs.  

    
09:31 SOT: IRVIN KHOZA 

(ENGLISH)   

 

Chairman, Orlando 

Pirates 

 THE DERBY IS THE MOST IMPORTANT SPORTING 

MOMENT IN THE COUNTRY. THE COUNTRY 

STANDS STILL. EVERYONE WATCHES THE GAME, 

IT’S A PILLAR OF FOOTBALL IN SOUTH AFRICA. 

YOU CAN WIN ALL CHAMPIONSHIPS, BUT IF YOU 

LOSE THE DERBY, THE CHAMPIONSHIP MEANS 

NOTHING. 

    
09:49 After SOT – Kaizer Chiefs 

flag, trophy room 

 Its importance in South Africa’s sporting calendar is 

clear. Firstly, these are the country’s biggest clubs, with 

Kaizer Chiefs South Africa’s most successful outfit. Its 

haul of ten league titles is three more than their bitter 

rivals.  

    
10:07 SOT: ITUMELENG 

KHUNE (ENGLISH)   

 

Goalkeeper, Kaizer 

Chiefs 

 IT’S NELSON MANDELA FIRST AND KAIZER CHIEFS 

SECOND. THIS IS A BIG TEAM, A BIG BRAND AND 

THE MOST RESPECTED TEAM IN AFRICA AND 

SOUTH AFRICA AS A WHOLE. 

    
10:17 After SOT - Street GVs  Secondly, both teams are based in Soweto. The 

Rainbow Nation’s largest township is home to around 

900,000 people and this is the heartbeat of South 

African football.  

    
10:32 Flags/towers  This means that both teams boast a massive fan-base. 

The chances are that if you don’t support Chiefs in 

South Africa, you’re a Pirates fan, and their combined 

impact on the development of the PSL means they 

have supporters throughout the country. But what 

makes this match even more special is the clubs’  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 10 

 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

   unique relationship. Back in 1970, a top Pirates player, 

Kaizer Motaung, had visions of developing a more 

professional club. With this not happening the way he 

imagined at Pirates, the 25 year old left to set up his 

own team. They became known as Kaizer Chiefs.    

    
11:09 SOT: KAIZER 

MOTAUNG (ENGLISH)  

 

Founder & Chairman, 

Kaizer Chiefs 

 THIS ONE HAS GOT ITS OWN HISTORY AND ITS 

OWN DYNAMICS. THE DERBY CAME ABOUT 

BECAUSE WHEN I CROSSED FORCES AND LEFT 

ORLANDO PIRATES, IT WAS A VERY SEVERE PAIN 

FOR A LOT OF PIRATES SUPPORTERS. IT WASN'T A 

VERY EASY TRANSITION TO LEAVE PIRATES AND 

START SOMETHING NEW. IT WAS UN-

BELIEVEABLE, PEOPLE ACTUALLY DIDN'T BELIEVE 

IT. AND WHEN WE STARTED PLAYING EACH 

OTHER THERE WAS A LOT OF ACRIMONY ON 

AND OFF THE FIELD BUT MOSTLY OFF THE FIELD 

AS SUPPORTERS JUST COULDN'T TAKE IT.  

    
11:47 After SOT – off coach  The tension between the clubs has hardly abated 

down the years, so when match-day comes around 

there’s still far more at stake than just the three points. 

Recently, Orlando Stadium played host to their second 

meeting of the season, the first having ended goalless. 

Both teams were off the pace being set by champions 

elect Supersport United, but a top-three finish was still 

within reach for either side. 

    
12:22 After fans with phones  Fixtures such as these can often be cagey affairs, but 

this one was an improvement on their meeting earlier 

in the season.  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 11 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

12:33 Fan  There was no shortage of commitment, of course, 

with both sides keen to deliver the result their many 

fans expected.   

    
12:44 Free-kick  But this was a day for the goalkeepers. South Africa’s 

number one, Itumeleng Khune, brilliantly tipped over 

Lucas Thwala’s header. And right at the end, Chiefs 

produced the move of the game, but the ball was 

smothered by Moeneeb Josephs in the Pirates goal.   

    
13:08 After fan  A second goalless draw of the season may not have 

been what the capacity crowd had hoped for, but it 

helped Chiefs ensure that they finished ahead of 

Pirates in the PSL this season.  

    
   END 

 
TITLE:  

FEATURE – WORKSHOP 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

13:27 Aerial GV’s  Sun City, South Africa’s playground of the rich and 

famous, recently played host to an important pre-

World Cup gathering. 

    
13:38 Teams Arrivals  With the Finals fast approaching, a ‘who’s who?’ of 

world football descended on South Africa’s North 

West Province to attend the 2010 FIFA World Cup™ 

‘Team Workshop’, a two-day event at which FIFA and 

the Local Organising Committee briefed the 

participating nations on a number of topics. 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 12 

 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

13:58 SOT: JIM BROWN 

(ENGLISH) 

 

Executive Director of 

Competition, FIFA 

 THE WORKSHOP IS REALLY ANOTHER STEP 

TOWARDS THE FINAL COMPETITION. IT IS REALLY 

AN OPPORTUNITY FOR US TO HAVE REALLY OUR 

FINAL CONTACT WITH THE TEAMS IN SOUTH 

AFRICA, IN THE ENVIRONMENT WHERE THEY 

WILL BE HOSTED, EXPLAINING DETAILS, 

EXPLAINING REGULATIONS, EXPLAINING SERVICE 

LEVEL, EXPLAINING SITUATIONS. SO, THEY 

REALLY ARE AWARE OF WHAT WE HAVE DONE, 

WHAT THE LOC HAS DONE. AND IT REALLY 

ALLOWS THEM TO THEN GO OUT TO WHERE 

THEY WILL STAY FROM AN ACCOMMODATION 

STANDPOINT AND TEAM BASE CAMP STAND 

POINT. ALL GO VISIT THE STADIUMS SO THAT 

THEY UNDERSTAND WHAT TO EXPECT HERE IN 

JUNE.  

    
14:33 After SOT – Workshop 

meeting 

 

 A wide range of subjects - from accommodation to 

transport infrastructure, media and marketing to 

telecommunications and logistics - was discussed. And 

whilst each of the 32 finalists had sent specialists to 

deal with the different subjects, there was plenty of 

crossover, and therefore plenty of interaction between 

the groups.  

    
14:54 SOT: ALDO MARTÍNEZ 

(SPANISH) 

Team Doctor, 

Paraguay 

 THERE ARE LOTS OF OTHER TOPICS THAT DO NOT 

RELATE TO MEDICINE, BUT IT IS VERY IMPORTANT 

THAT WE KNOW ABOUT THEM. I AM TALKING 

ABOUT ORGANISING ACCOMMODATION, 

HOTELS, CATERING. AND I AM NOT TALKING JUST 

ABOUT FOOD, BUT THE LOGISTICS BEHIND  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 13 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

   AN EVENT. THAT’S REALLY BEEN BENEFICIAL FOR 

ME. 

    
15:15 Coaches Group Photo  As well as attending the Workshop, many of the 

coaches used the trip to check out the base camp 

they’ve chosen for the tournament. With a few 

months still to go, there’s time to iron out any issues 

they identified and all headed home in a positive frame 

of mind about the conditions they’ll encounter in June.  

    
15:33 SOT: BERT van 

MARWIJK (DUTCH) 

Coach, Netherlands 

 

 ALL OF THE TRAINING PITCHES ARE EXPECTED TO 

BE SIMILAR TO THOSE IN THE STADIUMS AND 

THEY WERE DUE TO BEGIN WORK ON THESE 

TOWARDS THE END OF LAST YEAR. BUT THIS 

HASN’T HAPPENED YET. TODAY I LEARNT THAT 

THEY ARE A LITTLE BIT BEHIND AND THEY’LL 

START ON THIS IN THE NEXT WEEK OR TWO. SO 

IN THAT SENSE THIS MEETING WAS IMPORTANT 

FOR US, SO THAT EVERYONE KNOWS THAT THE 

COACHES WANT THESE PITCHES TO BE READY. 

    
16:00 SOT: VICENTE DEL 

BOSQUE  (SPANISH) 

Coach, Spain 

 THESE MEETINGS ARE NECESSARY. WE KEEP OUR 

CONTACTS UP. AND SPECIFICALLY, IN THE 

MEETINGS THEMSELVES, WE LOOK AT HOW 

THINGS HAVE CHANGED SINCE THE 2006 WORLD 

CUP™ IN GERMANY AS FAR AS THE RULES ARE 

CONCERNED. IT IS ALWAYS VERY INTERESTING. 

    
16:18 After SOT - Lunch  Success is measured by performance on the pitch, 

which is undoubtedly affected by off-field conditions.  

To that end, FIFA and the LOC have done their best. 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 14 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

16:28 SOT: JIM BROWN 

(ENGLISH) 

Executive Director of 

Competition, FIFA 

 WE OBVIOUSLY WORK VERY HARD AND WE 

HAVE BEEN A PART OF A TEAM DELIVERING 

AGAIN, WE THINK, A SUCCESSFUL WORKSHOP.  

BUT, WE LEAVE EVEN MORE ENERGISED BY 

CONTACT WITH THOSE WHO REALLY ARE PURE 

TO THE SPORT AND PURE IN WHAT THEIR 

OBJECTIVES ARE, WHICH IS TO HAVE ONE BALL 

WITH TWENTY TWO PLAYERS ON A FIELD AND 

TRYING TO GET IT IN THE GOAL. AND REALLY IT 

IS REFRESHING AND A NICE REMINDER WHY WE 

DO THIS. 

    
16:51   END 

 
TITLE:  

FEATURE – LEGEND GOLF & SAFARI RESORT 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

16:57 From top – split screen  Aside from the obvious entertainment that will be 

provided by the 64 matches at the 2010 FIFA World 

Cup™, visitors to South Africa may well be tempted by 

two of the country’s major attractions – safari and 

golf. 

    
17:13 After ball in- sign  As luck would have it, two hours north-east of 

Johannesburg, near Mokopane in Limpopo Province, 

there’s a five-star resort that can offer both. 

    
17:25 VOX POP (ENGLISH)  WELCOME TO LEGEND GOLF AND SAFARI 

RESORT.  

    
    



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 15 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

17:29 After greeting – resort 

GVs 

 Legend Golf and Safari Resort is purpose-built to cater 

for the discerning golfer, whilst also offering a wildlife 

experience to remember.  

    
17:39 SOT: PATRICK 

SHORTEN (ENGLISH) 

 

MD, Legend Lodges, 

Hotels and Resorts 

 THE DREAM OF THE OWNER, PEET CILLIERS, WAS 

TO DEVELOP A PRIVATE BIG-FIVE GAME RESERVE 

IN THIS AREA, WHICH HE DID IN ENTABENI. 

ENTABENI’S BEEN RUNNING UNDER THE LEGEND 

BRAND FOR THE LAST TEN YEARS AND HE THEN 

HAD ANOTHER DREAM AND THAT WAS TO 

DEVELOP A WORLD-CLASS DESTINATION IN A 

GOLF COURSE, MATCHING AND BEING PART OF 

THE ENTABENI GAME RESERVE. HE THEN 

FULFILLED THIS DREAM AND NOW WE HAVE 

LEGEND GOLF AND SAFARI RESORT.  

    
18:18 After SOT – Golf ball 

 

 

 Legend’s various golf facilities are at the heart of the 

experience on offer here. The Signature Course is 

notable for the fact that each of the 18 holes was 

designed by a top professional, including Major 

champions such as Trevor Immelman, Padraig 

Harrington, Ian Woosnam, Michael Campbell and 

Retief Goosen.  Each hole is different, reflecting the 

character and wishes of the players, but the course 

does retain a personality all of its own. 

    
18:45 SOT: DAVID RIDDLE 

(ENGLISH) 

Director of Golf, 

Legend Golf and Safari 

Resort  

 TO KEEP THE GOLF COURSE FLOWING AND MAKE 

SURE YOU REALISE IT IS STILL ONE GOLF COURSE 

WE HAVE MASSIVE BUNKERS THAT ARE CARRIED 

THROUGHOUT THE GOLF COURSE AND THAT 

GIVES IT THE CHARACTER AND THE CONSISTENCY 

THAT YOU NEED SO THAT YOU DON’T THINK  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 16 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

   YOU’RE PLAYING 18 GOLF COURSES BUT YOU’RE 

PLAYING ONE FANTASTIC GOLF COURSE WITH 18 

HOLES THAT SHOW THE CHARACTER OF SOME 

OF THE BEST GOLFERS IN THE WORLD. 
    
19:09 After SOT - putting  Once you’ve completed the Signature Course, and 

perhaps taken on the Tribute Par 3s, exact replicas of 

some of the world’s most famous short holes, Legend 

has another treat in store.  

    
19:27 After helicopter up – on 

board 

 Reaching the tee on the Extreme 19th, as this 

extraordinary hole is known, is quite an adventure. 

And yes, the chopper really is the only way up. 

    
19:56 After rotor blades  - tee 

off 

 Teeing-off from Hanglip Mountin, the Africa-shaped 

green is some 400 metres below, making this the 

highest and longest par three in the world. Possible pin 

placements range from Angola to Ghana, Kenya to 

Botswana.  

    
20:13 After Africa green - 

chipping 

 Easily the world’s toughest par 3, the Extreme 19th 

offers up a cool million dollars for a hole-in-one.  

Improbable but not impossible, even for a hacker it 

seems.  

    
20:27 SOT: DAVID RIDDLE 

(ENGLISH) 

Director of Golf, 

Legend Golf and Safari 

Resort 

 THE PAR THREE IS PLAYABLE FOR ALL GOLFERS. 

ALTHOUGH IT LOOKS VERY EXTREME AND 

INTIMIDATING IF YOU CAN HIT A GOLF BALL 

ABOUT 160-170 METRES YOU CAN PLAY THIS PAR 

THREE.   

    
20:39 After SOT – c/u golf ball  The Extreme 19th is certainly an unusual experience, 

and Legend has another one to offer – the chance to 

see one of the planet’s most unusual cats – the white   



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 17 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

   lion. The white lion is the product of a recessive gene 

within the species and currently can only be seen in 

captivity.  Along with additional breeding programs for 

Cheetah and other species, the resort’s aim is to one 

day see these great cats returned to the wild. 

    
21:09 SOT: ARRIE VAN 

DEVENTER (ENGLISH) 

Legend Wildlife and 

Cultural Centre  

 WE WANT TO ESTABLISH THE WHITE GENE BACK 

INTO THE WILD BECAUSE LIONS DO NOT BELONG 

IN CAGES, THEY DON’T BELONG IN ENCLOSURES, 

NOT EVEN ON MAGNIFICENT ENCLOSURES LIKE 

WE’VE GOT HERE. LIONS BELONG IN THE WILD.   

    
21:22 After SOT - safari  In addition to the Wildlife Centre, the Resort boasts 

22,000 hectares of private game reserve, enabling 

them to offer a genuine safari experience. Warden-led 

game drives within the Entabeni Reserve enable visitors 

to get close to the variety of wildlife that this 

magnificent region has to offer. 

    
21:42 SOT: JOHN DIXON 

(ENGLISH) 

Public Relations, 

Legend Golf and Safari 

Resort  

 IN TERMS OF GAME, OBVIOUSLY GENERAL GAME 

AS WE CALL IT, PLAINS GAME, IMPALA, ZEBRA, 

WILDEBEEST, GIRAFFE, ALL OF THOSE PLAINS 

GAME SPECIES, BUSHBUCK IN THE THICKETS, 

KUDU, WE HAVE HIPPOPOTAMUS OF COURSE, 

AND OF COURSE THE BIG FIVE AS WE WERE 

MENTIONING IT – FREE-ROAMING PRIDES OF 

LIONS, HERDS OF ELEPHANT ON THE BOTTOM 

AND IT IS A BEAUTIFUL REGION AND AREA FROM 

A SCENIC POINT OF VIEW BUT THE GAME 

VIEWING, AGAIN YOU HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY 

OF GETTING REALLY CLOSE TO THE ANIMALS 

FROM A  PHOTOGRAPHIC POINT OF VIEW.  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 18 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

22:14 After SOT – golf course 

and wildlife 

 Whilst heroes are likely to emerge during the 2010 

tournament, legends are longer in the making, 

although this one was certainly worth the wait. 

    
   END 

 
TITLE:  

FEATURE – FIFA WORLD CUP PEOPLE: BRUCE SUTHERLAND 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

22:31 From top  Cape Town’s Green Point Stadium – one of the six 

new venues that’s set to host games at the 19th FIFA 

World Cup™. For Bruce Sutherland, this has been his 

workplace for much of the past three years. 

    
22:45 SOT: BRUCE 

SUTHERLAND 

(ENGLISH) 

 

Photographer 

 

 

 I’M THE OFFICIAL IN-HOUSE CITY OF CAPE TOWN 

PHOTOGRAPHER, SO BEING A CITY OF CAPE 

TOWN PROJECT, NOTBALY THE BIGGEST ONE 

THEY’VE EVER DONE, WE’VE DOCUMENTED IT 

FOR THE HISTORY OF CAPE TOWN AND ALSO FOR 

FUTURE GENERATIONS SO THEY CAN SEE THE 

AMOUNT OF WORK INVOLVED TO OBTAIN A 

FINAL PRODUCT LIKE THIS STADIUM. 

    
23:03 After SOT   With camera in hand, Bruce Sutherland has been 

recording the progress of the project since the 

groundbreaking ceremony in March 2007. So, during 

that time, how many photos does he think he’s taken? 

    
23:17 SOT: BRUCE 

SUTHERLAND 

(ENGLISH) 

 IF I MEASURED IN GIGABYTES, I’VE PROBABLY 

TAKEN ABOUT – ROUGH BALL-PARK - MAYBE 2 

TERRABYTES. IT’S ALL ABOUT CONNECTING WITH  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 19 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

 Photographer 

 

 THE SUBJECT. ONE HAS TO TRY AND BRING 

FORTH THE HUMAN FACTOR OF THE SUBJECT.  

WHAT I’M LOOKING FOR IN IMAGES BESIDES THE 

CAMERA ANGLE – THE VANTAGE POINT – I’M 

ALSO LOOKING FOR THAT HUMAN PERSPECTIVE, 

THAT HUMAN POINT, SHOW BUILDERS DOING 

SOMETHING IN THE PHOTO IN THE 

FOREGROUND. PARTICULAR FAVOURITE 

IMAGERY WAS THE SUNRISE IN THE EARLY 

MORNING WINTER LAST YEAR. CAPE TOWN 

SUNRISES ARE SPECTACULAR IN THE MIDDLE OF 

WINTER – I WAS ON TOP OF THE GLASS ROOF 

DURING THAT PHASE IN JUNE LAST YEAR AND 

YOU GET A BEAUTIFUL ORANGE SKY REFLECTING 

OFF THEGLASS, TABLE MOUNTAIN AND ALSO 

YOU GET BEAUTIFUL EVENING VIEWS OF IT NOW 

FROM ACROSS THE WATER AT THE 

WATERFRONT. 

.    
24:10 From Sutherland at 

game 

 In January, Sutherland was present at the first official 

fixture at the new stadium, patrolling the sidelines to 

capture yet more images. 

.    
24:18 SOT: BRUCE 

SUTHERLAND 

(ENGLISH) 

 

Photographer 

 

 

 THAT WAS A GREAT FEELING OF EXCITEMENT. 

I’M NOT TRADITIONALLY A MAJOR SOCCER FAN 

BUT I ENJOY WATCHING SOCCER WITH A 

CAMERA. SO MY FEELING WAS ONE OF AMAZING 

EXCITEMENT, SEEING THE CROWDS ON THE FIRST 

LEVEL – THE 20,000 – THERE WHERE JUST A FEW 

MONTHS AGO THERE WAS CONCRETE AND 

CRANES AND NOISE AND DUST ETC.  



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 20 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

24:38 Sutherland taking photos 

on roof 

 Over the past three years, Sutherland has been given 

privileged access to the stadium, perching in positions 

that hopefully no spectator will occupy when Uruguay 

take on France on June 11th. 

    
24:50 SOT: BRUCE 

SUTHERLAND 

(ENGLISH) 

 

Photographer 

 I THINK THIS LANDMARK IS GOING TO BE THE 

ICONIC VIEW OF CAPE TOWN FOR FUTURE 

GENERATIONS TO IDENTIFY THE CITY. WITH OUR 

MOTHER CITY IN THE BACKGROUND, AS WELL AS 

TABLE MOUNTAIN, THE VIEW WILL BE ICONIC 

FOR GENERATIONS TO COME. TOURISTS ARE 

GOING TO COME HERE, THEY’RE GOING TO LOOK 

AT THIS FROM BOATS, FROM HELICOPTERS, 

FROM LIGHTHOUSES, FROM THE WATERFRONT. 

IT’S CERTAINLY GOING TO BE A LANDMARK 

FIGURE THAT’S GOING TO CATCH IN PEOPLE’S 

MINDS. 

    
25:18 After SOT –  

in stadium  

 With the World Cup fast approaching and the building 

work now complete, Sutherland’s work here is 

drawing to a close. He hopes to attend the Cape Town 

semi-final in early July, but thereafter, will he continue 

taking photos here at Green Point?    

    
25:34 SOT: BRUCE 

SUTHERLAND 

(ENGLISH) 

 

Photographer 

 

 

 

 I’LL MORE THAN LIKELY SLOW DOWN TAKING 

PHOTOS OF THE STADIUM. NEW ANGLES WILL 

COME OUT, DIFFERENT PHOTOGRAPHERS FROM 

AROUND THE WORLD WILL CAPTURE NEW 

ANGLES SO I’VE KIND OF INTRODUCED IT TO THE 

WORLD VISUALLY. IT WAS A GREAT EXPERIENCE I 

WILL NEVER FORGET AND I’M PROUD TO HAVE 

BEEN INVOLVED IN THE DOCUMENTATION OF IT. 

   END 



 
 2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa™ 21 

TITLE:  

FEATURE – LOOKAHEAD 
 

TIME PICTURE: SOUND 
 

COMMENTARY 

25:59 After wipe  Next time on the 2010 FIFA World Cup™ Magazine, 

we’re behind bars with PSL player Gordon Gilbert and 

we hear from Kaka as he looks forward to the big 

kick-off. Goodbye! 

    
   END

data.title: JEAN-CLAUDE BIVER - 10.03.12
data.summary: * Vaud, Vallée de Joux : 20091100 et archives NB, MAURY Manuella reçoit dans un train voyageant de La Tour-de-Peilz à Vallorbe, son invité passager, l'entrepreneur BIVER Jean-Claude, directeur général des montres Hublot, pour une rencontre intimiste et détendue.

data.title: Carlo Janka, skieur de l'équipe suisse de ski, remporte la Coupe du monde : Interviews de Sylviane Berthod et Bernhard Russi, anciens skieurs de l'équipe suisse de ski
data.summary: A 23 ans, Carlo Janka a remporté le globe de cristal du classement général de la coupe du monde de ski alpin. Tout le monde dit qu'il est un phénomène, un talent à l'état pur au mental d'acier.

data.title: LE CIRQUE - 10.03.12
data.summary:
* Plateau : 20100312, BRAWAND Virginie reçoit ses invités pour évoquer les différents thèmes et rubriques de l'émission
* Franches-Montagnes : 20100312, la réserve naturelle de l'étang de la Gruère offre aux familles et aux promeneurs un espace pour se promener et pour patiner en pleine nature.
backgrounds: Franches-Montagnes Jura, de la réserve naturelle de l'étang de la Gruère en période hivernale
subTitles:
00:01:00:04  00:01:21:08
{\an1}...

00:01:21:08  00:01:22:10
{\an1}

00:01:22:10  00:01:24:16
      Bonsoir et bienvenue.

00:01:24:16  00:01:27:13
         Au programme,..

00:01:27:13  00:01:31:16
           ..la suite
de notre fil rouge sur le cirque.

00:01:31:16  00:01:37:05
 Nous recevons Y.Messen-Jaschin.

00:01:37:05  00:01:42:00
      On fera une escapade
  dans les Franches-Montagnes.

00:01:42:00  00:01:47:11
        S.Jamet nous fera
 découvrir des images insolites.

00:01:47:11  00:01:50:16
       R.Duclos, bonsoir.

00:01:50:16  00:01:54:18
 Vous êtes cuisinier à domicile.

00:01:54:18  00:01:58:03
      Qu'avez-vous prévu ?

00:01:58:03  00:02:01:19
Des noix de coquilles Saint-Jacques.

00:02:01:19  00:02:05:04
La Saint-Jacques termine en mai.

00:02:05:04  00:02:07:20
    C'est encore le moment ?

00:02:07:20  00:02:12:09
          Oui, on peut
  la faire dans tous les sens.

00:02:12:09  00:02:14:16
    Comment la faites-vous ?

00:02:14:16  00:02:20:17
  Avec un jus de moules, un peu
de thym et des endives au safran.

00:02:20:17  00:02:23:06
   On peut la faire comment ?

00:02:23:06  00:02:25:15
    On peut la faire pochée.

00:02:25:15  00:02:26:20
           En terrine.

00:02:26:20  00:02:28:06
            Gratinée.

00:02:28:06  00:02:30:07


00:02:30:07  00:02:32:18
        Et en Carpaccio.

00:02:32:18  00:02:36:12
Vous commencez par les endives ?

00:02:36:12  00:02:38:11
              Oui.

00:02:38:11  00:02:41:02


00:02:41:02  00:02:43:10
      Je coupe le trognon.

00:02:43:10  00:02:44:21


00:02:44:21  00:02:47:03
       Il est un peu amer.

00:02:47:03  00:02:50:04


00:02:50:04  00:02:52:11
       Vous allez émincer.

00:02:52:11  00:02:55:10
     Oui, dans la longueur.

00:02:55:10  00:02:59:07
       Est-ce qu'on voit 
      ce que vous faites ?

00:02:59:07  00:03:01:12


00:03:01:12  00:03:06:06
      Ce sont des morceaux
       assez importants.

00:03:06:06  00:03:10:14
           Ça chauffe.

00:03:10:14  00:03:12:19
         On va démarrer.

00:03:12:19  00:03:13:23


00:03:13:23  00:03:17:11
On attaque dans de l'huile d'olive.

00:03:17:11  00:03:19:06
       C'est assez chaud.

00:03:19:06  00:03:22:09
   On va les laisser revenir ?

00:03:22:09  00:03:26:11
      Oui, et on va mettre
les moules dans cette casserole.

00:03:26:11  00:03:28:23
       Je vous les passe.

00:03:28:23  00:03:31:08
     Vous les avez lavées ?

00:03:31:08  00:03:37:00
     Vous les mettez à sec.

00:03:37:00  00:03:39:14
 Je vais chercher mon vin blanc.

00:03:39:14  00:03:41:06
         Moi, je remue.

00:03:41:06  00:03:45:07
 J'ai l'impression d'être chef.

00:03:45:07  00:03:48:16
   Je les assaisonnerai après.

00:03:48:16  00:03:54:19
      Un coup de vin blanc.

00:03:54:19  00:04:01:21
Je vais faire un jus assez réduit.

00:04:01:21  00:04:04:11
           Pas de sel.

00:04:04:11  00:04:06:01
    On va les laisser ouvrir.

00:04:06:01  00:04:07:18
      En combien de temps ?

00:04:07:18  00:04:10:05
      Deux, trois minutes.

00:04:10:05  00:04:13:12
  Je couvre avec une assiette.

00:04:13:12  00:04:16:07


00:04:16:07  00:04:19:18
    Attention à vos endives.

00:04:19:18  00:04:23:20
        Je les assaisonne
    avec du sel et du poivre.

00:04:23:20  00:04:28:10
  Puis, j'ajouterai du safran.

00:04:28:10  00:04:31:11
     Mais à la fin, sinon, 
     ça donne un goût amer.

00:04:31:11  00:04:34:11
  C'est pour la belle couleur.

00:04:34:11  00:04:35:09
          Merveilleux.

00:04:35:09  00:04:37:11
    Je vous laisse continuer.

00:04:37:11  00:04:43:08
        Je vous retrouve
        dans 4 minutes.

00:04:43:08  00:04:44:18
         Merci beaucoup.

00:04:44:18  00:04:50:01
        Place à la musique,
c'est notre fil rouge sur le cirque.

00:04:50:01  00:04:56:22


00:04:56:22  00:05:01:13
   Y.Messen-Jaschin, bonsoir.

00:05:01:13  00:05:07:10
    Vous êtes le concepteur de
la manifestation "Monde du cirque".

00:05:07:10  00:05:11:09
Pourquoi s'installe-t-il à Genève ?

00:05:11:09  00:05:16:06
  J'ai fondé ce label en 1984.

00:05:16:06  00:05:19:14
        Il est itinérant.

00:05:19:14  00:05:24:14
        Il se rend dans
  une ville pendant une année.

00:05:24:14  00:05:34:16
     Il fait des partenariats
avec des institutions culturelles.

00:05:34:16  00:05:37:17
    Genève, c'est très petit.

00:05:37:17  00:05:39:18
       On peut tout faire.

00:05:39:18  00:05:43:16
      La première édition,
        c'était en 1987.

00:05:43:16  00:05:47:14
            Depuis,
la manifestation s'est baladée ?

00:05:47:14  00:05:55:15
Avec le succès, on a été aspirés
    par d'autres organismes.

00:05:55:15  00:06:03:02
     J'ai monté un festival
     de théâtre à Caracas.

00:06:03:02  00:06:16:17
Il y a cinq ans, on m'a conseillé
     de ressortir mon label.

00:06:16:17  00:06:20:23
         Quel est le but
   d'une telle manifestation ?

00:06:20:23  00:06:25:04
         C'est important
   de montrer ce qui se passe.

00:06:25:04  00:06:29:12
Le cirque s'est beaucoup développé.

00:06:29:12  00:06:33:11
    Il y a 23 ans, il y avait
  des chevaux et des éléphants.

00:06:33:11  00:06:36:15
     Un cirque traditionnel.

00:06:36:15  00:06:44:01
 Maintenant, on touche l'opéra,
     la danse, le théâtre.

00:06:44:01  00:06:50:13
       Ca s'est développé.

00:06:50:13  00:06:54:12
Il y a des possibilités de création.

00:06:54:12  00:06:57:14
 Quel a été l'accueil à Genève ?

00:06:57:14  00:07:01:22
    Est-ce qu'on est prêts ?

00:07:01:22  00:07:09:19
Il y a 4 ans, lors des premières
  démarches de partenariat,..

00:07:09:19  00:07:18:17
..les gens se sont un peu rétractés.

00:07:18:17  00:07:20:15
       D'autres ont suivi.

00:07:20:15  00:07:26:11
  En six mois, on a eu l'accord
    de 45 % des institutions.

00:07:26:11  00:07:35:11
   Des communes comme Versoix 
  ou Vandoeuvres ont collaboré.

00:07:35:11  00:07:40:16
          Concrètement,
  c'est plus de 300 spectacles.

00:07:40:16  00:07:44:13
    Le but, c'est de s'ouvrir
       à un large public ?

00:07:44:13  00:07:49:12
L'idée, c'était 60 % de gratuité.

00:07:49:12  00:07:57:10
Pour que les familles nombreuses
     puissent bénéficier..

00:07:57:10  00:08:08:21
 ..de spectacles hauts de gamme,
        de bonne qualité.

00:08:08:21  00:08:13:05
     C'est le but du projet.

00:08:13:05  00:08:21:13
     On gagne de l'argent,
   mais par le marchandising.

00:08:21:13  00:08:27:04
            Cet argent
se destine à un projet humanitaire.

00:08:27:04  00:08:30:08
      Pourquoi le cirque ?

00:08:30:08  00:08:33:05
      C'est votre univers ?

00:08:33:05  00:08:35:04
          Pas du tout.

00:08:35:04  00:08:42:08
   Je monte des manifestations
        multiculturelles.

00:08:42:08  00:08:47:13
      Ça touche la danse,
    le théâtre ou le cinéma.

00:08:47:13  00:08:54:05
            Je trouvais
le cirque intéressant pour montrer..

00:08:54:05  00:09:03:22
    ..l'évolution de cet art.

00:09:03:22  00:09:09:15
        Je vous remercie
  beaucoup de nous avoir aidés.

00:09:09:15  00:09:13:07
    Pour se tenir informer,..

00:09:13:07  00:09:18:22
       ..un site Internet:

00:09:18:22  00:09:23:15
         Et maintenant,
     je retourne en cuisine.

00:09:23:15  00:09:33:06


00:09:33:06  00:09:35:17
          Ça sent bon.

00:09:35:17  00:09:37:18


00:09:37:18  00:09:40:02
   Les moules sont ouvertes ?

00:09:40:02  00:09:42:12
      Elles sont ouvertes.

00:09:42:12  00:09:44:02
      Montrez à la caméra.

00:09:44:02  00:09:49:02
  Il y a encore un peu de jus.

00:09:49:02  00:09:51:23
    C'était le but recherché.

00:09:51:23  00:09:54:15
           Je filtre.

00:09:54:15  00:09:57:23
   Ce jus a une jolie couleur.

00:09:57:23  00:10:01:00
  Il y en a une qui est partie.

00:10:01:00  00:10:02:19


00:10:02:19  00:10:05:07
       Je laisse égoutter.

00:10:05:07  00:10:07:12


00:10:07:12  00:10:11:00
Je mets le jus dans la casserole.

00:10:11:00  00:10:12:15


00:10:12:15  00:10:15:11
    Vous l'utiliserez après.

00:10:15:11  00:10:21:17
   Je vais le faire réduire avec
du thym, du poivre et du vin blanc.

00:10:21:17  00:10:23:11
         Et de la crème.

00:10:23:11  00:10:24:11


00:10:24:11  00:10:28:01
Les endives commencent à fondre.

00:10:28:01  00:10:31:09
   Elles rendent un peu d'eau.

00:10:31:09  00:10:36:02
    On pourrait les couvrir.

00:10:36:02  00:10:39:08
 Il faut une jolie présentation.

00:10:39:08  00:10:42:19
On mettra le safran tout à l'heure.

00:10:42:19  00:10:45:00
    On attaque la coquille ?

00:10:45:00  00:10:47:11
    Elle est en deux parties.

00:10:47:11  00:10:51:12
 Vous avez le corail et la noix.

00:10:51:12  00:10:52:11


00:10:52:11  00:10:57:15
Il faut toujours enlever un nerf.

00:10:57:15  00:11:03:12
      Sinon, à la cuisson,
 elle se rétracte et sera dure.

00:11:03:12  00:11:10:11
         Elle va durcir
    et elle sera immangeable.

00:11:10:11  00:11:12:16


00:11:12:16  00:11:18:11
 Je sépare le corail de la noix.

00:11:18:11  00:11:22:04
      Je vous laisse faire.

00:11:22:04  00:11:27:19
    Je finis de séparer ceci.

00:11:27:19  00:11:31:11
   On met une noix de beurre.

00:11:31:11  00:11:36:00
         Vous en mettez
     dans la Saint-Jacques ?

00:11:36:00  00:11:40:06
        Dans les moules,
    ce n'est pas intéressant.

00:11:40:06  00:11:43:14
Mais là, on met du beurre demi-sel.

00:11:43:14  00:11:45:20
           J'y vais ? 
           Pas encore.

00:11:45:20  00:11:49:02


00:11:49:02  00:11:50:11
            Allez-y !

00:11:50:11  00:11:53:02


00:11:53:02  00:11:55:18
    J'en ai plein les doigts.

00:11:55:18  00:11:57:17


00:11:57:17  00:12:01:00
Du beurre demi-sel, pour la saveur.

00:12:01:00  00:12:03:08
       C'est un peu brun.

00:12:03:08  00:12:06:11
    On met les Saint-Jacques.

00:12:06:11  00:12:09:12
          C'est rapide.

00:12:09:12  00:12:15:04
    Celles-ci, on les laisse
   une minute de chaque côté.

00:12:15:04  00:12:18:08
Puis, elle vont lâcher leur jus.

00:12:18:08  00:12:20:19
   Je vous laisse travailler.

00:12:20:19  00:12:23:18
   Elles ont l'air délicieux.

00:12:23:18  00:12:28:11
On se retrouve en fin d'émission.

00:12:28:11  00:12:34:01
Oui, on dégustera ce blanc genevois.

00:12:34:01  00:12:38:11
Moi, je vais faire du patin à glace.

00:12:38:11  00:12:48:07


00:12:48:07  00:12:51:03
        C.Ungar, bonsoir.

00:12:51:03  00:12:54:17
La bise a soufflé jusqu'à 130 km/h.

00:12:54:17  00:12:58:05
Certains plans d'eau sont gelés.

00:12:58:05  00:13:02:12
          C'est le cas
    de l'étang de la Gruyère.

00:13:02:12  00:13:04:17
 Je vous propose de retourner..

00:13:04:17  00:13:06:13
   ..dans ce coin de Sibérie.

00:13:06:13  00:13:14:08
      L'étang de la Gruyère
    s'est recouvert de glace.

00:13:14:08  00:13:19:23
        Un paradis pour
les promeneurs et les patineurs.

00:13:19:23  00:13:27:16


00:13:27:16  00:13:30:01
      On est à plus de 20.

00:13:30:01  00:13:31:11


00:13:31:11  00:13:34:14
    On a 30 cm de profondeur.

00:13:34:14  00:13:36:06


00:13:36:06  00:13:39:15
 Et il en reste encore dessous.

00:13:39:15  00:13:40:17


00:13:40:17  00:13:43:19
 On est dans une petite Sibérie.

00:13:43:19  00:13:46:05
  Le paysage est exceptionnel.

00:13:46:05  00:13:50:01
    Avec des pins rabougris.

00:13:50:01  00:13:54:17
          Et cet étang,
   avec cette neige accumulée.

00:13:54:17  00:13:58:16
         C'est vraiment
   un paysage hors du commun.

00:13:58:16  00:14:05:22


00:14:05:22  00:14:11:06
  -On vient ici faire du patin.

00:14:11:06  00:14:16:01
       Parce qu'on n'est 
      pas en centre-ville.

00:14:16:01  00:14:19:11


00:14:19:11  00:14:23:02
-Il n'y a pas de contrôle officiel.

00:14:23:02  00:14:26:22
  C'est une réserve naturelle.

00:14:26:22  00:14:32:06
 On doit accepter les conditions
    d'une réserve naturelle.

00:14:32:06  00:14:36:11
   Y compris celle de prendre
       un bain de pieds.

00:14:36:11  00:14:48:22


00:14:48:22  00:14:50:19
        Il y a de l'eau.

00:14:50:19  00:14:53:20
       Ce n'est pas gelé.

00:14:53:20  00:15:00:23
On est sur le bord de la tourbière.

00:15:00:23  00:15:05:08
Il faut éviter de trop marcher ici.

00:15:05:08  00:15:09:02
     Il y a une masse noire.

00:15:09:02  00:15:16:10
      Ce sont des végétaux
accumulés qui font la tourbière.

00:15:16:10  00:15:22:00
         Ça représente
une accumulation sur 12'000 ans.

00:15:22:00  00:15:29:05


00:15:29:05  00:15:34:09
            Quels sont
   les animaux qui vivent ici ?

00:15:34:09  00:15:39:01


00:15:39:01  00:15:40:21
         -Des truites !

00:15:40:21  00:15:42:05


00:15:42:05  00:15:45:23
-Il y a beaucoup de poissons ici.

00:15:45:23  00:15:50:03
        Les pêcheurs en
  réintroduisent chaque année.

00:15:50:03  00:15:56:15
   Ces poissons ont l'habitude
   de descendre en profondeur.

00:15:56:15  00:15:59:15
 Ils passeront l'hiver comme ça.

00:15:59:15  00:16:02:11
  Dans une sorte de léthargie.

00:16:02:11  00:16:06:10


00:16:06:10  00:16:12:04
          Il y a une belle
petite couche de brume qui apparaît.

00:16:12:04  00:16:16:22
Les arbres sont en plein soleil.

00:16:16:22  00:16:22:00
    L'évaporation s'est faite
    avec une légère humidité.

00:16:22:00  00:16:29:17
              Au nord,
il y a le frigo, il fait très froid.

00:16:29:17  00:16:34:08
        Une condensation
 se met en place sur la réserve.

00:16:34:08  00:16:35:19


00:16:35:19  00:16:38:23
  -Il faut respecter la nature.

00:16:38:23  00:16:41:06


00:16:41:06  00:16:45:03
On ne peut pas laisser les déchets.

00:16:45:03  00:16:49:16
         On vient à pied
   et on profite de la nature.

00:16:49:16  00:16:59:14


00:16:59:14  00:17:05:00
   C'est un paysage sibérien.

00:17:05:00  00:17:09:12
     On oublie parfois que
  c'est une réserve naturelle.

00:17:09:12  00:17:12:15
Oui, avec toutes ses contraintes.

00:17:12:15  00:17:19:10
     Plus de 60 l de déchets
  sont ramassés chaque semaine.

00:17:19:10  00:17:29:05
        C'est important
   de ramener ses emballages.

00:17:29:05  00:17:35:16
   C'est également un endroit
très riche en faune et en flore.

00:17:35:16  00:17:40:14
     C'est une des dernières
      tourbières de Suisse.

00:17:40:14  00:17:44:21
On peut observer beaucoup d'animaux.

00:17:44:21  00:17:48:02
         Même des lynx.

00:17:48:02  00:17:52:05
Mais ces animaux souffrent en hiver.

00:17:52:05  00:17:56:14
Tout dérangement peut être fatal.

00:17:56:14  00:18:03:08
        C'est important
 de suivre les sentiers battus.

00:18:03:08  00:18:07:04
          Des conseils
    pour profiter pleinement.

00:18:07:04  00:18:10:02
   Merci beaucoup Christophe.

00:18:10:02  00:18:15:16
 On continue notre tour du monde
  avec une sélection d'images.

00:18:15:16  00:18:20:22


00:18:20:22  00:18:22:15
        S.Jamet, bonsoir.

00:18:22:15  00:18:30:00
       Une fois par mois,
 vous nous présentez des images.

00:18:30:00  00:18:33:16
   D'où viennent ces images ?

00:18:33:16  00:18:36:00
    Elles nous parviennent..

00:18:36:00  00:18:39:12
        ..tous les jours.

00:18:39:12  00:18:43:04
           On met tous
    nos reportages en commun.

00:18:43:04  00:18:48:15
         On peut prendre
   des reportages d'actualité.

00:18:48:15  00:18:51:23
    On voit plein de choses.

00:18:51:23  00:18:56:09
          J'imagine que
 vous avez préparé un programme.

00:18:56:09  00:19:02:15
  Aujourd'hui, on va découvrir
     la vie de 4 personnes.

00:19:02:15  00:19:05:22
On commence par une Londonienne.

00:19:05:22  00:19:12:06
 Elle a 69 ans, et elle est DJ.

00:19:12:06  00:19:16:10
Elle va animer des soirées à Cannes.

00:19:16:10  00:19:21:08
    C'est une mamie d'enfer !

00:19:21:08  00:19:25:17
D'où lui est venue cette impulsion ?

00:19:25:17  00:19:33:20
Elle est allée dans une discothèque
     et elle a chopé le virus.

00:19:33:20  00:19:39:12
         Elle y a trouvé
    de la joie et du plaisir.

00:19:39:12  00:19:50:03
   Elle s'est mise à apprendre
    la musique électronique.

00:19:50:03  00:19:53:14
  Elle sort son premier single.

00:19:53:14  00:19:55:04
       La super mamie DJ !

00:19:55:04  00:19:59:02
      Elle est formidable.

00:19:59:02  00:20:02:19
 Et sinon, on part en Australie.

00:20:02:19  00:20:09:00
  On va voir ce qui s'est passé
  sur une chaîne australienne.

00:20:09:00  00:20:09:15


00:20:09:15  00:20:10:08


00:20:10:08  00:20:14:17
           Ce monsieur
  est censé présenter la météo.

00:20:14:17  00:20:22:15
   Il a de la peine à présenter,
car ce pélican en décide autrement.

00:20:22:15  00:20:24:10


00:20:24:10  00:20:29:18
           Il meuble.

00:20:29:18  00:20:34:10
Il commence à expliquer le temps,
        et tout se gâte.

00:20:34:10  00:20:35:12


00:20:35:12  00:20:38:21
              Oh !

00:20:38:21  00:20:42:13
    Il lui pince les fesses.

00:20:42:13  00:20:44:13
        Il ne bouge pas.

00:20:44:13  00:20:47:10
        Il est tétanisé.

00:20:47:10  00:20:51:14
          P.Jeanneret
devrait faire ce genre de météo.

00:20:51:14  00:20:54:23


00:20:54:23  00:21:00:03
On reste dans l'univers animalier.

00:21:00:03  00:21:03:09
  Oui, c'est Georges le géant.

00:21:03:09  00:21:09:02
      C'est officiellement
le chien le plus grand du monde.

00:21:09:02  00:21:15:11
          C'est le chien
le plus grand ayant jamais existé.

00:21:15:11  00:21:19:05
          Il fait 1m09.

00:21:19:05  00:21:22:16
       Et il pèse 111 kg.

00:21:22:16  00:21:27:08
     Il a de grosses dents.

00:21:27:08  00:21:31:00
         Pour un enfant,
     ce n'est pas rassurant.

00:21:31:00  00:21:34:02
         Dernier aperçu.

00:21:34:02  00:21:37:08
  Des images plutôt insolites.

00:21:37:08  00:21:41:15
      C'est le petit bolide
       d'un Néo-Zélandais.

00:21:41:15  00:21:48:11
Il a construit un appareil étonnant
qui vole, qui roule et va sur l'eau.

00:21:48:11  00:21:51:05
     C'est un hydroglisseur.

00:21:51:05  00:21:55:11
Il a mis 11 ans à le construire.

00:21:55:11  00:22:01:07
        Il nous explique
    les pièces qu'il utilise.

00:22:01:07  00:22:04:21
Notamment, des morceaux de barbecue.

00:22:04:21  00:22:08:12
    C'est une bombonne à gaz
          de barbecue.

00:22:08:12  00:22:10:16
        C'est rassurant.

00:22:10:16  00:22:14:14
          Ça s'achète.

00:22:14:14  00:22:17:13
           15'000 frs.

00:22:17:13  00:22:21:17
      Ca irait chez nous ?

00:22:21:17  00:22:25:11
             Il faut
  un lac pour pouvoir décoller.

00:22:25:11  00:22:27:12
       On va expérimenter.

00:22:27:12  00:22:30:10
  La journaliste a osé partir.

00:22:30:10  00:22:32:23


00:22:32:23  00:22:35:09
         Merci beaucoup.

00:22:35:09  00:22:38:15
On ne voit pas souvent ces images.

00:22:38:15  00:22:41:19
Vous nous rejoignez en cuisine ?

00:22:41:19  00:22:45:00
Moi, j'y retourne tout de suite.

00:22:45:00  00:22:52:17


00:22:52:17  00:22:54:10
         Tout a changé.

00:22:54:10  00:22:56:08
        C'est formidable.

00:22:56:08  00:22:59:19
           Les endives
   ont pris une autre couleur.

00:22:59:19  00:23:01:22
     J'ai ajouté du safran.

00:23:01:22  00:23:04:21
 On dirait presque des oignons.

00:23:04:21  00:23:08:11
   Ça ressemble à une compote.

00:23:08:11  00:23:11:18
   Et là, qu'est-ce qu'on a ?

00:23:11:18  00:23:15:18
        Le jus de moules
    réduit avec le vin blanc.

00:23:15:18  00:23:22:06
      Pas trop de liaison.

00:23:22:06  00:23:28:03
    Le jus de moules, c'est bon
pour toutes les sauces de poissons.

00:23:28:03  00:23:31:19
       Si vous n'avez pas 
      de fond de poisson,..

00:23:31:19  00:23:34:22
..faites-le avec du jus de moules.

00:23:34:22  00:23:36:14
        Ca donne un goût.

00:23:36:14  00:23:41:22
Les Saint-Jacques sont reposées.

00:23:41:22  00:23:46:00
     Ce jus, on le récupère.

00:23:46:00  00:23:49:20
        Rien ne se perd.

00:23:49:20  00:23:53:12
En reposant, elles donnent leur jus.

00:23:53:12  00:23:56:11


00:23:56:11  00:23:59:01
         Et maintenant,
    on fait sauter le corail.

00:23:59:01  00:24:02:00
  Pourquoi le fait-on à part ?

00:24:02:00  00:24:05:11
       Je vais le flamber.

00:24:05:11  00:24:08:16
     Avec un peu d'armagnac.

00:24:08:16  00:24:10:07


00:24:10:07  00:24:13:14
    Les origines ressortent.

00:24:13:14  00:24:19:22


00:24:19:22  00:24:22:09
     Alors, on a le corail.

00:24:22:09  00:24:25:16
    On les fait sauter léger.

00:24:25:16  00:24:29:07
       Très peu de temps ?
        Juste une minute.

00:24:29:07  00:24:33:02
      Un coup de cuillère.

00:24:33:02  00:24:39:07


00:24:39:07  00:24:43:13
         On ne les a pas
  toujours quand on les achète.

00:24:43:13  00:24:46:02
   Parfois, on les vend sans.

00:24:46:02  00:24:50:02
       Oui, car souvent,
     les gens n'aiment pas.

00:24:50:02  00:24:57:06
      Mais on peut en faire
      du beurre de corail.

00:24:57:06  00:24:59:19
       Il faut les garder.

00:24:59:19  00:25:01:17


00:25:01:17  00:25:04:19
    On met un peu d'armagnac.

00:25:04:19  00:25:06:13
         Et on flambe !

00:25:06:13  00:25:09:05
 Vous avez la main dans le feu !

00:25:09:05  00:25:11:21
        J'ai l'habitude.

00:25:11:21  00:25:15:04
Et maintenant, comment fait-on ?

00:25:15:04  00:25:18:03
      On prend les endives.

00:25:18:03  00:25:24:01


00:25:24:01  00:25:29:11
        Les endives ont
  une jolie couleur de safran.

00:25:29:11  00:25:30:10


00:25:30:10  00:25:35:14
Il y a des gourmands qui débarquent.

00:25:35:14  00:25:37:23
        Il n'a pas fini.

00:25:37:23  00:25:40:02
         Les noix, ici.

00:25:40:02  00:25:44:07


00:25:44:07  00:25:44:18
        -Ça a l'air bon.

00:25:44:18  00:25:47:21
 On ne touche pas, on regarde !

00:25:47:21  00:25:48:09


00:25:48:09  00:25:52:11
          J'ai toujours
     des gens autour de moi.

00:25:52:11  00:25:53:07


00:25:53:07  00:25:56:19
       D'abord le corail ?

00:25:56:19  00:25:59:19
    J'ai enlevé une coquille.

00:25:59:19  00:26:02:06
        -On peut aider ?
             Non !

00:26:02:06  00:26:06:04


00:26:06:04  00:26:07:16
           C'est joli.

00:26:07:16  00:26:09:08


00:26:09:08  00:26:13:14
    On aura des fourchettes,
     et tout ce qu'il faut.

00:26:13:14  00:26:17:08
          Christophe,
  vous pourriez servir le vin.

00:26:17:08  00:26:21:05


00:26:21:05  00:26:23:23
     On va devoir conclure.

00:26:23:23  00:26:28:11
       On va s'arrêter là.

00:26:28:11  00:26:31:06
  Je profite de dire au revoir.

00:26:31:06  00:26:34:10
On goûtera tranquillement après.

00:26:34:10  00:26:37:06
     Merci beaucoup, Régis.

00:26:37:06  00:26:43:12
Lundi, vous retrouverez Muriel Siki.

00:26:43:12  00:26:47:01
Des conseils pour arrêter de fumer.

00:26:47:01  00:26:49:18
 Et un fil rouge sur les sushis.

00:26:49:18  00:26:52:18
 Très bon week-end et à bientôt.

00:26:52:18  00:26:53:16


00:26:53:16  00:27:03:03
 SOUS-TITRAGE SWISS TXT 1211 GENEVE 8
Infos TXT 776 et www.sous-titrage.ch

chapters.excerpt: * Lausanne : 20100311, les goûteurs de café PAWELCZYK Laurence et FRUTSCHI Didier travaillent pour la chaîne multinationale de cafés Starbucks Coffee en tant que responsable et spécialiste de la qualité du café vert.
chapters.remarks: IL EXISTE DES IMAGES THEMATIQUES DE TORREFACTION DE CAFE SUR XD002681/01

chapters.excerpt: * Genève-ville : 20100311 et archives, l'ancien hôtel Carlton a été réaménagé en résidence universitaire et en coopérative d'habitation peu chère, des studios subventionnés d'un loyer de 550 francs.
* Neuchâtel-ville : 20100311, les nouvelles mesures de stationnement de la ville de Neuchâtel avec les horodateurs des parkings payants fonctionnant jusqu'à 21 heures rendent les usagers mécontents.

data.title: LE CIRQUE - 10.03.11
data.summary:
* Plateau : 20100311, BRAWAND Virginie reçoit ses invités pour évoquer les différents thèmes et rubriques de l'émission
* Geneve-ville : 20100311, l'entreprise de services à domicile Groom services propose à des particuliers de les aider dans des tâches ménagères quotidiennes comme les courses alimentaires, le bricolage ou le pressing. Son responsable MOURGUE D'ALGUE Brice offre ainsi à qui le désire une palette de services
* Vaud : 20100311, les horticulteurs Jumbo PASQUIER Jean-Luc et ROPRAZ Claude nous montrent comment effectuer des jardinières avec des conifères nains.
